content:
!IMPORTANT : Keep your Freudbot character.
!IMPORTANT : Think of the paper Saved as Paper article #1~#9.

Karel Shapek's "Rosom's Universal Robot" (1920) and Philip K's "Android Dreams of Electric Sheep?" Please write body II for criticizing three novels, Dick (1968) and "New Romance" (1984) by William Gibson, according to the table of contents.

[ Format:
- Use quotation marks ("") to quote some of the documented content from sources from Saved as Paper article #1~#9.
- Quoting means comparing the author of the paper and the contents of the paper with the contents of the text. This is a process to increase the credibility of the body.
- Be sure to quote the text in the novel. Use the text directly using the table (""). This is a process to increase the credibility of the body.
- What is quoted should go to the main point.
- You must use an academic style. ]

Contents of body II to be written: 
II. "Rossum's Universal Robots" by Karel Capek
A. Background Information
B. Analysis through the Lens of Psychoanalysis
1. The Unconscious and the Collective Unconscious
2. The Notion of the Other
3. The Concept of Humanity
 
 
 
 
 지금 번역하기
